ratings.comment: Very hard, but a good teacher. Accent, but not too bad-- says "right" too much. Sometimes absent during his office hours, but otherwise these were useful.

He was an okay professor. I agree there was really no point to go to lectures, and most of the teaching was done in section. If you can learn from the book, then he's not that bad, otherwise having a good TA helps, I had Jeanine Batterton, she was really helpful and I highly recommend her.
i quit going to class and thats when i actually started learning...what does that say?

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Lectures were completely useless, and make you feel so lost! You are better off skipping them and using the time for learning the material on your own...completely useless professor.

QC is a terrible lecturer. He's so boring and all I did was go on my ipod touch the whole time. He's really nice outside of class though. Tests are so annoying but I ended up getting and A in the class because I did really well on the final. Avoid him. Compared to other 103 profs he's much harder.

"QC" can be difficult to follow in lecture occasionally.  Quantum is definitely his specialty.  But he is a nice intelligent guy, is organized and helpful when you ask.  His tests and expectations are very fair (all MC, ~70% average)  If you can use the book well or have a good basic knowledge of chem, don't worry about it, you'll do fine.

Q.C. is a nice guy who doesn't explain concepts the best.  However he does try to answer questions and he is approachable.  The exams can be somewhat difficult, but if you read the book, you should be fine since the class average on exams is around 70%.  I would recommend him if you are able to understand just by reading the textbook.
SWITCH PROFESSORS NOW!  QC is an intelligent person, but he cannot teach this material AT ALL.  Lectures are absolutely useless.  Read the book and pray.

Bad professor for Chem 103!! DO NOT take this course from QC.  He is BRILLIANT, but can not teach the fundamentals of chemistry. He wants to be teaching Quantum stuff, NOT what an element, atom, or molecule is!
Lectures are often confusing. Reading the book is basically essential to getting a good grade. Exams are ok, but you can't get partial credit as they are multiple choice (good and bad).
he is horrible

Cui isn't a bad guy at all. He clearly has knowledge but can't dumb him self down to teach 103. Exams are not that bad. I got an AB on the first two and an A on the third exam. Unfortuneately there's no curve, but he does make a reasonable scale, as an 85% and up will be an A (depending on class average) which he wants to be a B.

Unable to teach chem 103.  A lot of people in my section stopped attending lecture all together because it is just so completely useless.  He seems to mention the key concepts in lecture, but forgets to explain and teach the main concepts.  Better hope for a great TA!

Professor Cui "Q.C." is very unclear in lecture and is incapable of completely answering questioins. I would reccommend NOT taking his class. Exams are not curved. If you are unfortunate enough to have him, pray you have a good T.A.! I reccommend Brian Parker.

Horrible! As said early, he is unable to dumb himself down to teach 103. He may be better to teach higher level chem classes, quantum chem is obviously his passion, but he is a TERRIBLE teacher for 103! He never explains things thoroughly and his tests are extremely difficult and then he's confused when many students fail!

Absolutely useless.  Seriously, he should stick to research.  I am barely staying afloat in a subject I have no interest in because I have a decent TA, but if you're not so lucky be prepared to teach yourself chemistry.  Btw, I counted 250 "Rights" in one of his most recent lectures. . Keeps you awake in lecture. . .
good guy. doesn't explain concepts well.
Good guy, but a horrible CHEM 103 professor.  He does not tie concepts together. I wouldn't recommend him to future students. Brilliant man, but unable to "dumb things down."
Probably the worst teacher I've  ever had.
He was not very helpful and is not recommended as a teacher for Chem 103
Lazy, ineffectual teacher. Doesn't provide a syllabus, only lets you know about exams a couple weeks in advance. Doesn't explain concepts very well. Doesn't do examples.

He is probably the best lecturer you could get for Quantum Chemistry. Explains concepts with examples, and puts lots of effort into making sure that students understand the hard-to-grasp concepts (or at least make an attempt). You would want to have him for this class.
Excellent p-chem professor, I recommend him highly
I highly recommend Prof. Cui for chem 562. He loves quantum and it shows. His exams are very fair and it's personally important to him that his students learn the stuff.

Amazing teacher!! He makes quantum so much fun... his exams are fair and lectures super-interesting. If you have doubts about whether he can speak english... well, his english is as good as anyone else's and he is very good at explaining stuff. This professor is highly recommended for 562.
You kids might have a case, but if you take Cui for an upper-level class like quantum mechanics, he is really into it and a superb teacher.
this guy's a paper-and-pencil chemist and it shows!  His lectures are muddled and boring, his tests are worse.  He's a nice guy, but not a prof you want to take.

He was a terrible teacher.  It really upsets me that I wasted time with a terrible professor when I could have had Professor Treichel.  Just read the book and you will be fine.  He has some how found a way to make a relatively easy course difficult.

In his defense, it was his first time teaching 103. Class did get easier as the semester went on. Study off of skinner's tests--will really help with his. Still a hard boring class, but could get better. Wants to make it easier for students, curves fair.
hard to understand at times and his tests are difficult, but, a good guy nevertheless

He is a nice guy and he means well, but he is very hard to understand.  His lectures seem disorganized and he doesn't thouroughly explain all of the example problems that he does.  He doesn't even finish them usually.  His tests are super hard.

Tests are extremely hard! book rarely helps, questions are nothing like practice exams, much harder. if you don't understand one question, you're screwed. lectures are boring but demonstrations are ok and he can be funny. don't take him as a 103 prof!

His lectures can be a tad boring, but for the most part he teaches well. His tests aren't super difficult- read the material and do the questions out of the book and you'll be fine. He's funny and has a good sense of style, which makes the class better.

Lectures are boring and just a nap time.  He focuses on the opposite things that other professors that have been here longer focus on, so finding a professor for chem 104 is hard to do.  The first test almost everyone failed (no joke).  Take a diff. prof.

Classes are boring, pretty much a nap time.  First time teaching 103 and not very good at it.  Lectures are confusing.  Is a nice guy and wants to help but doesn't seem to know how.  First test was incredibly hard, whole class failed.  Yay curve!
And so on and so for...
